title.narrative: 3.7 DRR CAPACITY OF STAKEHOLDERS

description.narrative: Capacity enhanced at state and district levels for planning, implementation, budgeting and public financial management for most disadvantaged children., which contributes to Adolescent Empowerment, Child Poverty / Public Finance For Children, Child Protection And Emergencies, Child Protection â€“ General, Corporate External Relations And Partnerships, Communication And Resource Mobilization, Cross-Sectoral Adolescent Development, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Cross-Sectoral Planning And Programme Reviews, Environmental Sustainability, Health â€“ General, Immunization, Learning Outcomes, Nutrition And Emergencies, Other Cross-Sectoral Programme Areas, Policy Advocacy â€“ Urban, Civil Society, Parliament, Environment, Prevention And Response Services For Violence Against Children, Sanitation, Social Protection, Social Protection And Child Poverty, Technical Excellence In Humanitarian Action, Treatment Of Severe Acute Malnutrition, Wash And Emergencies, Water. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Developing And Leveraging Resources And Partnerships, Evaluations, Research And Data, Fostering Innovation And Use Of New Technologies, Operational Support To Programme Delivery, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Programme Component Results (PCR) 3: Adolescent participation and empowerment

sector.narrative: Adolescents participating in or leading civic engagement initiatives (including in humanitarian settings)

Relief co-ordination, protection and support services
Situation Analysis or Update on women and children
Stimulating demand for and capacity to use data
System strengthening - inclusive education for children with disabilities
Technical assistance - Prevention and response services for violence against children

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Capacity enhanced at state and district levels for planning, implementation, budgeting and public financial management for mostdisadvantaged children.

description.narrative: Risk Informed Programming was integrated in the 2018-22 country programme and up-scaled to five states. Child-centred disaster risk reduction was strengthened through development of two additional state DRR Roadmaps, review of 96 statutory District Disaster Management Plans, and endorsement of six state governments to scale-up School Safety and Security programme. | Status:On-track | As-of Date:13/01/2018
